benchmark_details.name: Profit: Benchmarking Personalization and Robustness Trade-off in Federated Prompt Tuning
benchmark_details.overview: This paper benchmarks fundamental federated learning algorithms applied to prompt tuning large language models to understand the trade-off between personalization and robustness under varying levels of data heterogeneity.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To study the trade-off between personalization and robustness in federated learning scenarios using large language models.

data.source: Super-NaturalInstructions (SNI), a collection of diverse NLP tasks.

methodology.calculation: Reported scores are computed through the evaluation of local and global test datasets after personalization.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ROUGE-L scores indicate better alignment between predicted and actual outputs.
methodology.baseline_results: FedAvg(Adam) outperformed other methods in most cases.
methodology.validation: Hyperparameters tuned via global validation sets constructed from all validation clients.
